pullRequest.body:
This workflow finds branches of the form `lean-pr-testing-NNNN`
corresponding to core PRs that have been merged into the latest nightly.
These branches should be merged into the `nightly-testing` branch of
mathlib.
The workflow only reports branches that have a non-trivial diff.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [49fbc9eb27](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17399/commits/49fbc9eb27173b193c24ff1b5440c310047cc23c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Looks like I forgot about this, sorry! Let's try it out!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11622493372/job/32368038337)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11622493372/job/32368038201)

I would probably also add a line like
```bash
printf 'Yesterday: %s\nToday: %s\nPRs: %s\n...' "$YESTERDAY" "$TODAY" "PRS" ...
```
so that there is a record in CI of all the variables that you used for debugging.

~~ I am confused... in a local test this seemed to not split `$MATCHING_BRANCHES` into separate branches. But it's a string containing 1 branch per line. Isn't that how bash works? ~~

Edit: forgot that I was using `zsh` locally, which is slightly different

Could it be the case that you added nothing to `branches`?  In that case, do you still want to send a message?

Maybe you can add an `if` clause to this step that checks whether `steps.find-branches.outputs.branches` is empty or not?

```suggestion
        echo "'$RELEVANT_BRANCHES'"
```
This way, you will see where they begin and end (and, in particular, it will be easier to detect if it is empty!

```suggestion
        cd "$(mktemp -d)" || exit 1
```
These guards are possibly superfluous, but act as stopgags in case something goes wrong and help getting better error messages.

Same comment on the `cd lean4-nightly` below that is probably more important!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - ci(.github/workflows): add discover-lean-pr-testing.yml
